content: these tiny doughnuts are knitted with 4 ply cotton yarn with one shade yarn a for the icing part and another yarn b for the lower dough part there are optional beads for decoration o t h e r k n i t t i n g p a t t e r n s a r e a v a i l a b l e a t https //littlecottonrabbits com © copyright 2019 all rights reserved j u l i e w i l l i a m s l i t t l e c o t t o n r a b b i t s page 1 m a t e r i a l s n o t i o n s yarns two colours of 4py/fingering weight yarn a pair of 2 25mm us 1 knitting needles yarn a for the icing colour and yarn b for the a tapestry needle for seaming with dough approx 4m 4yds of each toy stuffing g a u g e seed beads/embroidery thread optional to decorate the tops gauge 9 stitches x 11 row to 1 inch f i n i s h e d s i z e approx 3 5cm 1 ¼ inches diameter the original idea for this doughnut pattern was to make something small enough to fit into the pocket of my dungarees pattern see page 4 for illustrations and although it is a little tight it does just fit i tried so many prototypes trying to reduce the size further but they didn t work out as circular so this was as small as i could go and therefore the pattern is recommended to be worked with very thin needles 2 25mm us 1 in order that the doughnut made fits into the dungaree pocket if you do intend it for this purpose then please use a thin 4ply yarn with the 2 25mm/us 1 needles check your gauge and don t be too generous with the amount of stuffing that you use if you prefer you can use the doughnut as a stand-alone item size is then less important and you can knit it in dk weight yarn with 3mm needles to give a slightly larger size i hope you enjoy using this pattern and making a little snack for your knitted animal if you d like to see my other patterns you can find the full range here all little cotton rabbits patterns y a r n s u g g e s t i o n s i ve used bcgarn alba to make most of the doughnuts on the front cover although any 4ply/fingering weight yarn will work too suggestions for alternative yarns include phildar phil coton 3 drops safran dmc natura just cotton cascade ultra pima fine it also may be worth looking on ravelry to see what yarns others are using and recommending a b b r e v i a t i o n
